== Optional Exercise: Model add-on to change the close behavior of the IDE
=== Target
In this exercise you register an existing model add-on created in <<exercise_modeladdonclose" /> with the Eclipse IDE. This is done similar to the approach described in <<firstplugin_migratione4" /> , the only difference is that you contribute a model add-on.
=== Register model add-on via model fragment with the Eclipse IDE Create a model fragment which contributes the add-on to the application of the Eclipse IDE.
image::modeladdonide10.png[Adding a model add-on to the Eclipse IDE]
image::modeladdonide20.png[Adding a model add-on to the Eclipse IDE]
=== Verifying the model add-on in the Eclipse IDE Start a runtime Eclipse IDE with your plug-in included in the launch configuration. Ensure that your new close dialog is used if you try to close the IDE with a dirty editor.
